response:
The subacute onset (13 days) in a middle-aged female raises suspicion for inflammatory, demyelinating, or compressive etiologies. A compressive mass (neoplasm) is a critical rule-out. Demyelinating conditions like MS or NMOSD are strong possibilities given the hemicord presentation (partial myelitis).

differential_diagnosis = ["Thoracic Meningioma", "Thoracic Schwannoma", "Multiple Sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "Idiopathic Transverse Myelitis", "Thoracic Disc Herniation", "Spinal Dural Arteriovenous Fistula", "Spinal Cord Sarcoidosis"]
